etymology.description: Semantic: 卜(卜) (bǔ, "divination") + Phonetic: 月(月) (yuè, "moon") -> originally related to phases of moon for divination -> exterior
etymology.interpretation: The character 外(wài, "outside") combines 卜(卜) (bǔ, "divination") as a semantic element and 月(月) (yuè, "moon") as a phonetic element. This suggests divination practices related to moon phases, reflecting an understanding of measuring what is 'outside' or observable of the moon, thus extending to the concept of 'outside'.

examples.chinese: 孩子们在外玩耍(孩子們在外玩耍)。
他离开喧嚣(他離開喧囂)，向外探索(向外探索)。
examples.pinyin: Tā líkāi xuānxiāo, xiàng wài tànsuǒ.
examples.english: He leaves the hustle and bustle to explore the outside.

examples.chinese: 外國的文化充滿魅力(外國的文化充滿魅力)。
examples.english: Foreign cultures are full of charm.
